cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi E of the Mouth of the Mississippi River and 105 mi SSE of Biloxi, MS
cyclone.trajectory: very slowly drifting northwest, forecast to turn north then northeast and move ashore along the Mississippi‒Alabama coast before tracking inland across Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi/Alabama border, in the vicinity of Biloxi–Mobile Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to the Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL (Storm-Surge Watch areas)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: East of the mouth of the Pearl River to Navarre, FL – this includes Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi, Alabama, and the extreme western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are already spreading into coastal Alabama; hurricane-force gusts (possibly sustained) are likely late Tuesday night into Wednesday as the eye moves ashore. Peak sustained winds near the port could reach 65–75 mph with higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Forecast surge 6–9 ft for Mobile Bay and 4–7 ft from Dauphin Island to the AL/FL border.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches with locally up to 30 inches possible, producing historic, life-threatening flash flooding and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Embedded tornadoes in rainbands, dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged power outages, and significant river flooding that could disrupt port operations well after landfall.
